description: Borrowed from Middle French preparer, from Classical Latin praeparāre (“make ready in advance”), from prae- (“pre-”) + parāre (“make ready”).

verbs.description: prepare (third-person singular simple present prepares, present participle preparing, simple past and past participle prepared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make ready for a specific future purpose; to set up; to assemble or equip.
examples: We prepared the spacecraft for takeoff.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make ready for eating or drinking; to cook.
examples: We prepared a fish for dinner.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make oneself ready; to get ready, make preparation.
examples: We prepared for a bumpy ride.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To produce or make by combining elements; to synthesize, compound.
examples: She prepared a meal from what was left in the cupboards.
